intro: Cheiridopsis brachystigma, commonly known as the dwarf ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to its compact size and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
